caseStudy:
The concept client here was Crft and they were looking for a quick branding / visual suite including a web site to prepare for the grand opening of their music venue. They wanted a simple and modular identity.

So in this case I started with the logo, split into 4 to incorporate the modularity, and each piece represents a key aspect of the space.

Square to represent the actual physical location and ties to architecture.

Half circles going up followed by half circles going down to represent the party that goes on from sun up to sun down.

Finally the circle to represent records getting spun.

After that was sketched up I moved to the palette. It is mainly an off white and black palette meant to be complimented by a yellow (sun up) pink (sun down) green (fresh new space) and blue (nighttime).

For the site I kept things painfully simple, one page that introduces the ethos of the location, and the events of the month clearly listed with the ability to expand to see more details
